data.event: Ontario was founded on June 11, 1883, by developers William Morfitt, Mary Richardson, Daniel Smith, and James Virtue.
In March 1884, Richard Welch started a post office for the quarter of Ontario, so named by James Virtue after Ontario, Canada.

event.title: Two months later Joseph Morton applied

data.event: Two months later Joseph Morton applied for a Morton post office at an island about one mile south of town, with Oscar Scott as postmaster.
